meanings.definition: To make or create (something) by ingenuity or deception.
meanings.sent1: She was coigning a plan to surprise her friend at the party.
meanings.sent2: The magician was coigning a new trick to amaze the audience.
meanings.sent3: The students were coigning a secret code to communicate during class.
meanings.sent4: The artist coigned a masterpiece from his imagination.
meanings.sent5: The chef was coigning a unique recipe that no one had tasted before.

meanings.definition: To shape or mold (something) by hammering or stamping.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith was coigning the metal into a horseshoe.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor coigned the clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter was coigning the wood to build a sturdy table.
meanings.sent4: The potter coigned the clay into a delicate teacup.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler was coigning the gold into an intricate necklace.

meanings.definition: To secure or strengthen (something) by adding a wedge or support.
meanings.sent1: He was coigning the door to prevent it from slamming shut.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker coigned the beam to ensure it was stable.
meanings.sent3: The gardener was coigning the plant to keep it upright in the wind.
meanings.sent4: She coigned the bookshelf to prevent it from tipping over.
meanings.sent5: The engineer was coigning the structure to withstand the earthquake.
